intro: Cardiostigma nudum, commonly known as the naked heartleaf, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often glabrous. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grassland or forest margins. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is cultivated in some botanical gardens.
